page.title: 13RECREATION AROUND SCHOOL - 3
page.content: A well known local persuit is "tubing" Children lash a number of inner tubes together and walk the raft up stream as far as Trigon then float down stream to the Old Mill or North Bridge. The river is not all that wide and is quite shallow. The common is used a great deal for walking, riding, horse jumping, (many people graze their horses on the common), and angling. The river contains fish such as roach, pike, trout, salmon, sea trout and rainbow trout introduced from the U.S.A. Trigon Estate - This is a large country estate, it has it's own game keeper who raises pheasants. Shoots are organised and cost Â£100 per day. Stalking of Sika and Roe deer is let to foreign tourists from France, Belgium and Germany. They shoot primarily for sport and trophies.
